Newport, OR 97365

citations.narrative:
There was no facility attendant present within the human and animal interactive area. A male red kangaroo, allowed to
interact freely with guests, displayed aggressive dominant behavior with one patron by foaming and rubbing saliva from
his mouth while wrapping his forelimbs around the waist of an anxious guest who was trying to get away, but the
kangaroo was reluctant to let go. Not having an attendant present during public interaction with animals can affect animal
welfare by risking injury to the public as well as the animal. A responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable
employee or attendant must always be present during periods of public contact. Correct by 6 September 2024.

There is deteriorating wood with gaps and jagged edges at the bottom of the doors leading from the public/animal contact
area to feed storage room. Gaps with jagged edges in the door to the feed storage area affect animal welfare by potential
rodent contamination of feed or causing physical injury to free roaming animals. The facilities must be structurally sound
and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and prevent entrance or escape of pests and zoo
animals. Correct by 27 September 2024.

The pigeon enclosure with over 80 pigeons does not contain enough perches because there is inadequate space
available to allow all birds to perch at the same time. Insufficient number of perches decreases avian environmental
enrichment by preventing normal behavior of this species. The facility needs to provide enough perches to comfortably
hold all the birds in the primary enclosure at the same time. To be corrected by 13 September 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
ANDREA D AMBROSIO, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
2.131(d)(2) 
   
Handling of animals. 
There was no facility attendant present within the human and animal interactive area. A male red kangaroo, allowed to 
interact freely with guests, displayed aggressive dominant behavior with one patron by foaming and rubbing saliva from 
his mouth while wrapping his forelimbs around the waist of an anxious guest who was trying to get away, but the 
kangaroo was reluctant to let go. Not having an attendant present during public interaction with animals can affect animal 
welfare by risking injury to the public as well as the animal. A responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable 
employee or attendant must always be present during periods of public contact. Correct by 6 September 2024. 
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
There is deteriorating wood with gaps and jagged edges at the bottom of the doors leading from the public/animal contact 
area to feed storage room. Gaps with jagged edges in the door to the feed storage area affect animal welfare by potential 
rodent contamination of feed or causing physical injury to free roaming animals. The facilities must be structurally sound 
and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and prevent entrance or escape of pests and zoo 
animals. Correct by 27 September 2024. 
3.153(a)(2) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The pigeon enclosure with over 80 pigeons does not contain enough perches because there is inadequate space 
available to allow all birds to perch at the same time. Insufficient number of perches decreases avian environmental 
enrichment by preventing normal behavior of this species. The facility needs to provide enough perches to comfortably 
hold all the birds in the primary enclosure at the same time. To be corrected by 13 September 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.

Additional Inspectors: 
ANDREA D AMBROSIO, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
